Betaretrovirus is regarded as one of the environmental factors triggering the recurrence of primary biliary cirrhosis (PBC) after liver transplantation. Earlier and more severe recurrence of PBC occurred with tacrolimus compared with CsA as an immunosuppressant. This may be partially explained by the antiviral activity of CsA. According to an in vitro study, it was suggested that CsA interrupted viral replication through inhibiting viral protein synthesis, gag and envelope assembly, and particle budding.
